Text: CANCEL Warning NoticeWARNING CANCELLATION Effective at the California Independent System Operator has terminated the Warning of the Electrical Emergency Plan The Warning has been in effect since Sat Aug PDT This message is from Market Operations at the California ISO This notice cancels notice Notice issued at

Stage CANCELLATIONNOTICE Effective at the California Independent System Operator has terminated Stage of the Electrical Emergency Plan Stage has been in effect since Sat Aug PDT This message is from Market Operations at the California ISO This notice cancels notice Notice issued at

Stage Emergency EMERGENCY NOTICE Effective at the California Independent System Operator has implemented Stage of the Electrical Emergency Plan The Plan has been implemented for the following reasons Lack of resources Stage is expected to be in effect from HE through HE Participating transmission owners are to notify the Utility Distribution Companies within their operational areas Stage Operating reserves are less than minimum Advise the Utility Distribution Company of potential power shortages and request the UDC to advise enduse customers to reduce demand to minimum requirements without disruption of employment or curtailment of industrial production or commerce Advise the UDC to prepare for imminent implementation of the interruptible load programs andor electrical emergency plan This message is from Market Operations at the California ISO Notice issued at

Issue Warning NoticeWARNING NOTIFICATION For operating day the ISO is predicting deficiencies in Operating Reserve due to anticipated high loads and temperatures across the ISO Control Area today Effective The ISO is issuing a Warning notice and is requesting additional Supplemental Energy bids up to MW for Hour Ending through Hour Ending Those who have additional energy or capacity to provide are highly encouraged to submit bids into the supplemental energy market This message is from Market Operations at the California ISO Notice issued at

No Touch Day NoticeBill NonPrivilegedpst NO TOUCH DAY NOTIFICATION The ISO is anticipating high loads and temperatures across the ISO Control Area The California ISO is declaring a No Touch Day for the period from through No Touch Day restrictions as detailed in ISO Operating Procedure E will be in effect Market participants are cautioned to avoid actions which may unnecessarily jeopardize generator availability This message is from Market Operations at the California ISO Notice issued at DISCLAIMER The system conditions described in this communication are dynamic and subject to change While the ISO has attempted to reflect the most current accurate information available in preparing this notice system conditions may change suddenly with little or no notice
